subject: Politics
title: Can Corruption Be Eliminated
description: A short lesson to help you apply Can Corruption Be Eliminated.

hook.text: Denmark, New Zealand, and Finland prove that low corruption is possible. But can it ever reach zero?

buildup.text: No country has eliminated corruption entirely. Even the cleanest nations have scandals and blind spots.

discovery.text: Successful countries combine strong institutions, free press, fair official salaries, and cultures of accountability.

twist.text: Technology helps and hurts. Digital payments cut petty bribery, but cybercrime and crypto create new corruption tools.

climax.text: Reducing corruption requires constant vigilance. It's not a problem to solve once but a battle to fight forever.

punchline.text: Corruption can't be killed. It can be contained. The fight never ends.

quiz.question: What do the least corrupt countries have in common?
options: Strong institutions, free press, fair pay for officials, and cultures of accountability
No government or legal system at all
Complete government control over all media and courts
